title: Building a Sustainable Single-Use Coffee Cup - Advertising Specialty Institute
summary: The Good Cup is a recyclable plastic-free container with an integrated origami-style fold-and-snap lid designed to reduce single-use cup waste.
green_innovation: TRUE The Good Cup offers a sustainable solution to reduce environmental impact by addressing the issue of single-use plastic waste.
business_innovation: TRUE The introduction of The Good Cup represents a new product that significantly differs from traditional single-use cups, making it a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE The Good Cup is designed to reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle by promoting recycling and the use of environmentally friendly materials.
green_process: TRUE The process of manufacturing The Good Cup aims to minimize environmental impacts by using sustainable materials and recycling.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 322299 - All Other Converted Paper Product Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 322212 - Folding Paperboard Box Manufacturing, 322291 - Sanitary Paper Product Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE This innovation is not an example of greenwashing as it genuinely aims to reduce environmental impact and offers a sustainable solution to single-use cup waste.

title: Waste Reduction and Recycling | Saskatchewan State of the Environment â€“ 2023 - Government of Saskatchewan
summary: The article discusses Saskatchewan's commitment to waste management and recycling programs to reduce waste generation and promote environmental stewardship.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes various waste management and recycling initiatives aimed at reducing waste generation, promoting recycling, and enhancing environmental stewardship, aligning with green innovation principles.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on waste management and recycling programs rather than new or significantly improved products or business processes, therefore not meeting the criteria for business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article highlights multiple recycling programs and waste management strategies that promote the use of environmentally benign materials, sustainable production processes, and recycling functionalities, making it a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses methods and techniques in waste management and recycling that aim to minimize environmental impacts, conserve resources, and reduce harmful substances, qualifying them as green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 562111 - Solid Waste Collection, 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection
greenwashing: FALSE. The article provides factual information about waste management and recycling programs without making false or misleading environmental claims, thus not exhibiting greenwashing.
